responses: Hello! How can I help you with your education today?
Goodbye! Wishing you the best in your studies.
You're welcome!
Happy to help!
Any time!

patterns: What are the available courses after A/L?
Tell me about courses after A/L
I finished A/Ls, what can I study?
responses: You can choose from various courses such as IT, Management, Engineering, Medicine, Arts, and more.

patterns: What IT programs do you have?
I want to study Information Technology
responses: We offer IT diplomas, software engineering, computer science, and networking courses.

patterns: What engineering courses can I take?
Tell me about electrical engineering programs
responses: Yes! You can study Civil, Electrical, Mechanical, Software, and Electronic Engineering.

patterns: I want to become a doctor
responses: To study medicine, you should follow the Biology stream. Options include MBBS, Nursing, Pharmacy, and more.

patterns: What are the Arts stream options?
Can I study languages or history?
responses: Arts stream includes degrees like Sociology, Political Science, History, Languages, and Psychology.
You can study Accounting, Business Management, Marketing, Banking and Finance, and HRM.
Yes! We offer diplomas in IT, Management, English, Graphic Design, and more.

patterns: What countries can I study in?
responses: Yes, you can apply to universities in UK, Canada, Australia, and more. IELTS may be required.

patterns: How can I get a scholarship?
responses: We provide merit-based and need-based scholarships for selected programs.

patterns: What universities are in Sri Lanka?
responses: Top universities include University of Colombo, Moratuwa, Peradeniya, Ruhuna, Kelaniya, and J'pura.

patterns: Can I speak to an advisor?
Do you have a contact number?
I want to talk to someone
responses: You can call us at 076-3499289 or email mandaramalindu@gmail.com for help.
To study medicine in Sri Lanka, you usually need a Biology stream and a Z-score above 1.8. State universities include Colombo, Ruhuna, and Peradeniya. Private options: KDU, SAITM.
You can study Law at Colombo, J'pura and Open University. Entry requires a good Z-score in Arts. Private law diplomas available at CFPS, ICBT.
Management is offered at J'pura, Kelaniya, and Peradeniya. Commerce stream preferred. Private options: NIBM, NSBM, SLIIT.
Accountancy degrees are at J'pura and Kelaniya. You can also follow CA Sri Lanka, ACCA, or private degrees at NSBM, Horizon.

patterns: What to do after Arts stream?
responses: Arts degrees include Sociology, Languages, Psychology. Offered at Kelaniya, Peradeniya. Entry via Arts stream.
CS is offered at Colombo, Moratuwa, and Uva Wellassa. Private options: NSBM, IIT, SLIIT. Maths stream recommended.

patterns: I want to study Data Science
Where to study AI or Data Science?
responses: Data Science is available at Uva Wellassa, Colombo. Private: NSBM, IIT, and NIBM. Entry: Maths/Science stream.

patterns: What are civil and mechanical engineering?
responses: Engineering degrees (Civil, Mechanical, Electrical) are at Moratuwa, Ruhuna, Peradeniya. Z-score needed: above 1.4. Private: SLIIT, CINEC, IIT.
Nursing and Pharmacy are offered at Colombo, Rajarata. Z-score for Biology stream. Private: ICBT, ESOFT Metro.
You can study Education at NIE, Open University, or university faculties. Entry: any stream + good A/Ls.
Kurunegala: IDM, ESOFT. Badulla: Sussex, IDM. Jaffna: Vavuniya Campus, IDM. Colombo: NSBM, SLIIT, IIT.

patterns: List all campuses in Sri Lanka
Where can I study in Trincomalee?
responses: Major towns with campuses: Colombo, Galle, Kandy, Kurunegala, Jaffna, Matara, Badulla, Ratnapura, Kalutara, Trincomalee, Batticaloa. Institutes vary by location.

patterns: What is required to become a software engineer?
responses: Software Engineering is offered at universities like Moratuwa and Ruhuna. You usually need a high Z-score from Maths or Physical Science stream. Private options include NSBM, IIT, SLIIT and ESOFT.

patterns: What is the Z-score needed for medicine?
Minimum Z score for Moratuwa engineering?
responses: The required Z-score varies by year and district. For Medicine it's generally above 1.8; for Engineering above 1.4. Please check www.ugc.ac.lk for exact values.

patterns: What can I study in Kandy privately?
responses: In Colombo: SLIIT, NSBM, NIBM, ICBT, ESOFT. In Kandy: ESOFT, Horizon Campus. In Galle: ESOFT, IDM. In Jaffna: IDM, ESOFT. In Kurunegala: Sussex, IDM. In Matara: ESOFT, IDM. Availability depends on the institute and program.

patterns: How can I apply for foreign universities?
Can you help me with studying abroad?
Whom to contact for overseas education?
responses: You can contact us at 076-3499289 or email mandaramalindu@gmail.com. Visit www.studyabroad.gov.lk for detailed info.

patterns: What can I do after O/L?
Are there diploma courses after O/L?
responses: Yes, after O/L you can study diploma programs in IT, English, Graphic Design and more at institutes like VTA, NAITA, and private colleges.

patterns: What is the Grade 5 scholarship exam?
How can I prepare for 5 wasara shishyathwa?
responses: Grade 5 scholarship exam is for students in Sri Lanka to enter popular national schools. Materials are on www.doenets.lk.

patterns: Best websites for education in Sri Lanka
Where can I get accurate study info?
responses: Visit www.ugc.ac.lk (gov universities), www.tvec.gov.lk (vocational), www.doenets.lk (exams), and www.studyabroad.gov.lk (foreign study).
